comments: a(n) is also the number of distinct possible (n-1)-dimensional simplex if the (n-1)*n/2 1-faces are given (up to symmetry, rotation, reflection). - _Dan Dima_, Nov 03 2011a(n) is also the number of edge labelings of the complete graph on n vertices. - _Nikos Apostolakis_, Jul 09 2013
references: O. Frank and K. Svensson, On probability distributions of single-linkage dendrograms, Journal of Statistical Computation and Simulation, 12 (1981), 121-131.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
example: a(3)=1 since there is one possible triangle if the 3 edges are given and a(4)=30 since there are 30 distinct possible tetrahedron if the 6 edges are given. - _Dan Dima_, Nov 03 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
